result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D. Tock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Benjamin D. Tock is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Benjamin D. Tock was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to meet with payment clerk.
DNA surcharge.
Defendant to report to St. Croix County Jail and commence sentence no later than October 10, 2014 by 5:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin D. Tock

From DE requesting to make pymt on 10-28-15.  Ret'd call & left a v/m with DE approving pymt to be made by 4:30pm on 10-28-15 & reminded him that his pymts are due on or before the 20th of ea mo. jaf
DE called to verify if Sept pymt was rec'd as he thinks he may have included a case # for the wrong municipality.  Verified pymt was rec'd here and he is current until 10-20-15. jaf

From DE on 7-03-15 requesting  ext for pymt.  Called DE back this date & advised him his pymt is not due til 7-20-15.  DE stated he must have called wrong municipality.  Verified DE's amt & due date of 7-20-15 to him. jaf

c: Def, Atty, DA, Roberts PD & Jail. eif
signed by Defendant and Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Benjamin D. Tock appeared. Case called at 4:20 p.m. Plea questionnaire filed. ADA Nieskes informs Crt of agreement. DE to plead to Possession of THC without repeater. DE has completed Restorative Justice. DE pleads guilty to Amended Ct 1 - Possession of THC without repeater.  DE sworn. Attorneys stipulate to the facts.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Ct 1 - Possession of THC without repeater. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Recommendations. 

Crt orders:  

-5 days jail, credit for 1 day. DE to report and commence to SCC jail no later than 10-10-14 by 5:00 p.m.
-Court costs $518.00 Payable through a payment plan.

DE to meet with payment clerk today to set up a payment plan.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2014 at 04:15 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Sharon Correll,  DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp did not appear  DF:  Benjamin D. Tock appeared from jail.  QUASH WARRANT. Bond reinstated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 04:15 pm.
Return on warrant on August 14, 2014 at 01:05 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Matthew L. Hartung   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp   DF:  Benjamin D. Tock did not appear. Case called at 8:37 a.m. Court authorizes warrant and stays to 8-14-14 at 1:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in an warrant extraditable with adjoining states.  Return on warrant scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 01:05 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Alexis S Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey L Kemp   DF:  Benjamin D. Tock appeared. Case called at 4:16 p.m. Set for pre-trial. Atty Kemp has received Discovery and requests to continue for a possible agreement. DE has just started a new job. Bond continues.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
filed by ADA Michael Nieskes. eif
signed by Def. & Atty this date. eif
Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2014 at 04:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey L Kemp   DF:  Benjamin D. Tock appeared.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Not guilty.  Waives speedy trial. Discovery due within 20 business days. Motions due within 10 business days upon receipt of Discovery. Bond continues.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Michael E Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Jeffrey L Kemp   DF:  Benjamin D. Tock appeared. Set for preliminary. Case called at 4:32 p.m. Atty Kemp provides waiver of preliminary. Court informs DE of rights. Court questions DE. DE will waive preliminary. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary. Court accepts waiver and binds DE over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 04:15 pm.
Filed by Atty. Requesting a continuance for Prelim. Approved by SRN. km
Preliminary hearing on April 17, 2014 at 04:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Kemp. km
Appointing Atty Kemp. km
Preliminary hearing on April 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Random testing.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, with ANY UNDERAGE FEMALES (under 18 years old) except family.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Ashley J. Morse   DF:  Benjamin D. Tock appeared from jail.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 09:15 am.
